src.app.scrape module¶

class src.app.scrape.GradCafeScraping(base_url='https://www.thegradcafe.com')[source]¶

Bases: object

Scraper for TheGradCafe survey/results pages.

BASE_URL = 'https://www.thegradcafe.com'¶
scrape_data(path='/survey/')[source]¶

Fetch a page and return a BeautifulSoup parser.

Parameters:

path (str) – Path under the base URL to fetch.

Returns:

Parsed HTML document.

Return type:

bs4.BeautifulSoup

collect_records(max_records=150, delay=0.5, skip_rids=None)[source]¶

Collect records by walking the survey listing pages.

For each listing page (/survey/ then /survey/?page=N), extract result IDs, visit each detail page, parse fields, and accumulate a list of records until max_records is reached.

Parameters:

  • max_records (int) – Maximum number of records to collect.

  • delay (float) – Politeness delay (seconds) between requests.

  • skip_rids (set[str] or None) – Set of result IDs (strings) to skip.

Returns:

List of parsed result dictionaries.

Return type:

list[dict]

parse_results(rid: str, meta='')[source]¶

Scrape a single result detail page and return parsed fields.

Parameters:

  • rid (str) – Result ID (e.g., "123456").

  • meta (dict[str, dict] or str) – Optional metadata mapping produced by listing parsing, of the form {rid: {"date_added": str, "term": str}}. If not provided or mismatched, date/term are left as empty strings unless found on the detail page.

Returns:

A dictionary with normalized fields (program, degree, scores, etc.).

Return type:

dict
